abstract: New York Yankees have embraced art of pitch framing, in which catcher receives borderline pitch in way that compels umpire to call it as strike; catchers are specifically coached in technique, which has become far more scientific thanks to pitch-tracking cameras and quantitative analysis.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ Brian McCann has devoted himself to pitch framing, which helps pitchers get the benefit of the doubt on strike calls and which has become a darling of quantitative analysts.

headline.main: Developing a Little Sleight of Hand Behind the Plate
